alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 1:40PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN SOMERSET COUNTY THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 140 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Bittinger, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ursina around 145 PM EDT. Mount Davis around 155 PM EDT. New Centerville around 200 PM EDT. Meyersdale around 210 PM EDT. Somerset around 215 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Salisbury, Casselman, Rockwood, Confluence and Addison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
